Adam
Wolcott
Smith

Adam Wolcott Smith has written and recorded with many projects and bands from an early age, but it wasn’t until forming “Invisible Hand” that things moved to another level. After the completion of Invisible Hand’s self titled release he signed to a publishing company called Salinger Songs and through that was been presented with many opportunities to write and play with numerous artists like, Lena Fayre. In 2014 he produced and recorded the NYC artist Icewater And in 2016 he formed the band Zen Mother with his partner, Monika Khot. Together they have written and toured together, while continuing to stretch their musical abilities. In 2017 Zen Mother was awarded the Puget Soundtrack Residency, a Cue Northwest project produced in partnership by Brick Lane Records and Northwest Film Forum to perform a commissioned live score to Jodorowsky’s The Holy Mountain “When the 4th wall is broken, we will help it fall. When the imagery begs confusion, we will provide chaos. When comfort and solace is provoked, we will soothe you.” – Zen Mother on their score Zen mother will be releasing a new record in September of 2020 on The Flenser label from San Francisco In 2018 Adam joined playing keyboards in the nationally touring band from southern California, The Growlers. He has played with them all across the globe, playing nightly in 2000 capacity theaters from Australia to Germany; From Mexico back to the US. He also contributed songwriting to their 2019 release “Natural Affair”
